meanings.definition: A temporary ruler or regent in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent1: During the transition, the interrex governed the city.
meanings.sent2: The interrex was appointed to lead until a new ruler was chosen.
meanings.sent3: The interrex tried to rule with a scepter made of candy!
meanings.sent4: The interrex stood tall like a mighty oak tree in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The interrex's rule was as fleeting as a shooting star in the night sky.

meanings.definition: A person who holds power during an interregnum.
meanings.sent1: The interrex stepped in to maintain order during the transition.
meanings.sent2: As interrex, he ensured stability until a new leader emerged.
meanings.sent3: The interrex juggled flaming torches while balancing on a tightrope!
meanings.sent4: She was the interrex, bridging the gap between two eras.
meanings.sent5: The interrex's authority was a beacon of light in uncertain times.

meanings.definition: The period of time during which a temporary ruler holds power.
meanings.sent1: The interrex's term lasted until the new ruler was chosen.
meanings.sent2: During the interrex, the city awaited the next leader.
meanings.sent3: The interrex declared a holiday every day of the week!
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to stand still during the interrex's reign.
meanings.sent5: The interrex's era was a brief but impactful chapter in history.
